verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu <WH453> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
Hear <WH8085> my words <WH4405>, O ye wise <WH2450> men; and give ear <WH238> unto me, ye that have knowledge <WH3045>.
For the ear <WH241> trieth <WH974> words <WH4405>, as the mouth <WH2441> tasteth <WH2938> meat <WH398>. mouth: Heb. palate
Let us choose <WH977> to us judgment <WH4941>: let us know <WH3045> among ourselves what is good <WH2896>.
For Job <WH347> hath said <WH559>, I am righteous <WH6663>: and God <WH410> hath taken away <WH5493> my judgment <WH4941>.
Should I lie <WH3576> against my right <WH4941>? my wound <WH2671> is incurable <WH605> without transgression <WH6588>. my wound: Heb. mine arrow
What man <WH1397> is like Job <WH347>, who drinketh up <WH8354> scorning <WH3933> like water <WH4325>?
Which goeth <WH732> in company <WH2274> with the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205>, and walketh <WH3212> with wicked <WH7562> men <WH582>.
For he hath said <WH559>, It profiteth <WH5532> a man <WH1397> nothing that he should delight <WH7521> himself with God <WH430>.

Therefore hearken <WH8085> unto me, ye men <WH582> of understanding <WH3824>: far be it <WH2486> from God <WH410>, that he should do wickedness <WH7562>; and from the Almighty <WH7706>, that he should commit iniquity <WH5766>. men: Heb. men of heart
For the work <WH6467> of a man <WH120> shall he render <WH7999> unto him, and cause every man <WH376> to find <WH4672> according to his ways <WH734>.
Yea, surely <WH551> God <WH410> will not do wickedly <WH7561>, neither will the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> judgment <WH4941>.
Who hath given him a charge <WH6485> over the earth <WH776>? or who hath disposed <WH7760> the whole world <WH8398>? the whole: Heb. all of it?
If he set <WH7760> his heart <WH3820> upon man, if he gather <WH622> unto himself his spirit <WH7307> and his breath <WH5397>; man: Heb. him
All flesh <WH1320> shall perish <WH1478> together <WH3162>, and man <WH120> shall turn again <WH7725> unto dust <WH6083>.
If now thou hast understanding <WH998>, hear <WH8085> this: hearken <WH238> to the voice <WH6963> of my words <WH4405>.
Shall even he that hateth <WH8130> right <WH4941> govern <WH2280>? and wilt thou condemn <WH7561> him that is most <WH3524> just <WH6662>? govern: Heb. bind?
Is it fit to say <WH559> to a king <WH4428>, Thou art wicked <WH1100>? and to princes <WH5081>, Ye are ungodly <WH7563>?

How much less to him that accepteth <WH5375> not the persons <WH6440> of princes <WH8269>, nor regardeth <WH5234> the rich <WH7771> more than <WH6440> the poor <WH1800>? for they all are the work <WH4639> of his hands <WH3027>.

In a moment <WH7281> shall they die <WH4191>, and the people <WH5971> shall be troubled <WH1607> at midnight <WH2676> <WH3915>, and pass away <WH5674>: and the mighty <WH47> shall be taken away <WH5493> without hand <WH3027>. the mighty: Heb. they shall take away the mighty
For his eyes <WH5869> are upon the ways <WH1870> of man <WH376>, and he seeth <WH7200> all his goings <WH6806>.
There is no darkness <WH2822>, nor shadow of death <WH6757>, where the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> may hide <WH5641> themselves.
For he will not lay <WH7760> upon man <WH376> more than right; that he should enter <WH1980> into judgment <WH4941> with God <WH410>. enter: Heb. go
He shall break in pieces <WH7489> mighty men <WH3524> without number <WH2714>, and set <WH5975> others <WH312> in their stead. number: Heb. searching out
Therefore he knoweth <WH5234> their works <WH4566>, and he overturneth <WH2015> them in the night <WH3915>, so that they are destroyed <WH1792>. destroyed: Heb. crushed
He striketh <WH5606> them as <WH8478> wicked men <WH7563> in the open <WH4725> sight <WH7200> of others; open: Heb. place of beholders
Because they turned back <WH5493> from him <WH310>, and would not consider <WH7919> any of his ways <WH1870>: him: Heb. after him
So that they cause the cry <WH6818> of the poor <WH1800> to come <WH935> unto him, and he heareth <WH8085> the cry <WH6818> of the afflicted <WH6041>.

When he giveth quietness <WH8252>, who then can make trouble <WH7561>? and when he hideth <WH5641> his face <WH6440>, who then can behold <WH7789> him? whether it be done against a nation <WH1471>, or against a man <WH120> only <WH3162>:
That the hypocrite <WH120> <WH2611> reign <WH4427> not, lest the people <WH5971> be ensnared <WH4170>.
Surely it is meet to be said <WH559> unto God <WH410>, I have borne <WH5375> chastisement, I will not offend <WH2254> any more:
That which I see <WH2372> not <WH1107> teach <WH3384> thou me: if I have done <WH6466> iniquity <WH5766>, I will do <WH3254> no more.

Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense <WH7999> it, whether thou refuse <WH3588> <WH3988>, or whether thou choose <WH977>; and not I: therefore speak <WH1696> what thou knowest <WH3045>. according: Heb. from with thee?
Let men <WH582> of understanding <WH3824> tell <WH559> me, and let a wise <WH2450> man <WH1397> hearken <WH8085> unto me. of: Heb. of heart
Job <WH347> hath spoken <WH1696> without knowledge <WH1847>, and his words <WH1697> were without wisdom <WH7919>.
My desire <WH15> <WH1> is that Job <WH347> may be tried <WH974> unto the end <WH5331> because of his answers <WH8666> for wicked <WH205> men <WH582>. My: or, My father, let Job be tried
For he addeth <WH3254> rebellion <WH6588> unto his sin <WH2403>, he clappeth <WH5606> his hands among us, and multiplieth <WH7235> his words <WH561> against God <WH410>.
